column1: #Text=[0014] Other than the radiation heating, there is a method utilizing the heat conduction.
#Text=In this method, a plate with high thermal conductivity is made contact with the substrate at its backside.
#Text=When the backing plate is heated, the substrate is heated through heat transfer by the conduction from the backing plate to the substrate.
#Text=However, this method cannot be employed in case the backing plate is not used considering the energy-payback-time reduction.
#Text=In addition, it is difficult to make the baking plate contact with the substrate sufficiently and uniformly.
#Text=This brings disadvantage that highly efficient and uniform heating is impossible to the backing plate method.
#Text=[0015] In addition, by the backing plate method, the substrate is heated only from its backside.
#Text=As a result, temperature difference in the direction along the substrate thickness easily occurs with thick substrates.
#Text=Worse, the substrate may suffer a thermal deformation before it is heated up to a required temperature.
#Text=[0016] There may be another method where the substrate is heated from both sides by radiation.
#Text=Even if this method is adopted, it is difficult to keep a balance of heating from both sides because the TCO film that hardly absorbs infrared rays exists on one side of the substrate.

#Text=Particularly, if this method is carried out placing the substrate under a vacuum pressure, it is almost impossible to heat the substrate from both sides because heat transfer by the convection and the conduction cannot be expected.
#Text=[0017] Object of this invention is to solve problems described above.

#Text=[0018] To accomplish this object, the invention presents a thin-film deposition apparatus, comprising; a deposition chamber which is a vacuum chamber where thin-film deposition is carried out on a substrate at a deposition temperature higher than room temperature, and a heat chamber connected directly or indirectly with the deposition chamber, wherein the heat chamber is one which heats the substrate under the atmospheric pressure or a pressure higher than the atmospheric pressure, and has a mechanism to heat the substrate supplying gas of a temperature higher than the room temperature by forced convection.
